body_html:
@alextp Sounds good! I'll try to get those changes in today. One question I have related to this is whether to use tf_cuda_library and tf_cc_test, instead of cc_library and cc_test, as is done for the C API. What do you think?

Regarding the attribute name, I'll try to get some code that reproduces it in C++ so you can test. One thing I've noticed is that so far it only happens with attributes that have data types as values.
body_text:
@alextp Sounds good! I'll try to get those changes in today. One question I have related to this is whether to use tf_cuda_library and tf_cc_test, instead of cc_library and cc_test, as is done for the C API. What do you think?
Regarding the attribute name, I'll try to get some code that reproduces it in C++ so you can test. One thing I've noticed is that so far it only happens with attributes that have data types as values.
body:
@alextp Sounds good! I'll try to get those changes in today. One question I have related to this is whether to use `tf_cuda_library` and `tf_cc_test`, instead of `cc_library` and `cc_test`, as is done for the C API. What do you think?

Regarding the attribute name, I'll try to get some code that reproduces it in C++ so you can test. One thing I've noticed is that so far it only happens with attributes that have data types as values.
